page.title: 07FEATURES PAST & PRESENT
page.content:
{PRINCIPAL FEATURES PAST & PRESENT { }THE WELL CREEK The Well Creek stretches for eight miles from Salters Lode to Marmount Priory.The Well Creek is used for summer and winter sports.In the summer it is used for fishing and in the winter when the river is frozen over it is used for skating,also in the summer boats moor at mooring points
over night.The Well Creek is a natural river.It runs into the old course of the River Nene.The Well Creek links the Great Ouse and the River Nene.The Well Creek Trust help to keep the Well Creek Trust help to keep the Well Creek clean and tidy.About 20 years ago the Well Creek became weed ridden,rubbish choked and a stagnant ditch so the Well Creek Trust was formed.The Creek was reopened in 1975.
